oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brad McCuen interviewed by Jay Orr
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Brad McCuen being interviewed by Jay Orr of CMF. The interview was conducted on 4/8/88.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Brad McCuen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:00) -- Introduction of interview by Jay Orr of the Country Music Foundation. Jay Orr is interviewing Brad McCuen. (1:10) -- Brad McCuen discusses pitching a song, "We'll Sing In The Sunshine," by Gayle Garnett to the pop department of RCA. (3:06) -- Brad McCuen speaks about obtaining LP's from a cleaning lady who had mostly Nashville based records. Brad further speaks about the tension between New York and Nashville about country records. (3:34) -- Brad McCuen speaks about New York's divsion trusting Steve Sholes. (4:21) -- Jay Orr speaks about an Atlanta based band named the "Java Tones." (4:55) -- Brad McCuen speaks about Steve Sholes representing Nashville. (5:21) -- Brad McCuen speaks about a possible conflict between Steve Sholes and the colonel about recording Elvis. (7:31) -- Brad McCuen speaks about a deal between Steve Sholes and Bill Lowery. (8:34) -- Brad McCuen explains the RCA Victor master #'s. (10:10) -- Brad McCuen explains why he didn't attend most pop meetings at RCA. (11:50) -- Brad McCuen speaks about Hugo Winterhalter using triplets in string arrangements. (12:35) -- Brad McCuen describes Steve Sholes' business strategies when making records. (13:51) -- Brad McCuen speaks about the music business in 1956 and 1957.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McCuen, Brad;
